intro: Chaunochiton angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sea hare, is a species of sea slug belonging to the family Aplysiidae. It is characterized by its elongated, soft body and a distinctive, narrow leaf-like shape. The plant, though not a true plant, is often found in marine environments where it feeds on algae and other organic matter. Its body is typically covered in a layer of mucus, which helps it move and protect itself from predators. This species plays a role in coastal ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and serving as prey for various marine animals.
